TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit InvalidToolsetDefinitionException extends System.Exception

Docs.summary: This exception is thrown whenever there is a problem with the user's custom toolset definition file. The problem might be semantic or syntactical. If the problem is in the syntax, it can typically be caught by XSD validation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "DefaultMessageDisplayedByParameterlessCtorWriterMustSupply" This message takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.InsufficientMemoryException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The localized error message string.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message) cil managed

Docs.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.InvalidToolsetDefinitionException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string specified in `message`.|

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream. For more information, see [XML and SOAP Serialization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed

Docs.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The error code. This parameter can be a null reference ().
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.InvalidToolsetDefinitionException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string specified in `message`.|

MemberSignature.Value: public InvalidToolsetDefinitionException (string message, string errorCode, Exception innerException);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, string errorCode, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed

Docs.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The error code. This parameter can be a null reference ().

The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the `innerException` parameter is not a null reference ( in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]), the current exception is raised in a block that handles the inner exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets the exception error code that was thrown.
Docs.value: A string representing the error code.
